intro: Cyathula kilimandscharica, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro spurge, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, cup-shaped cyathium inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are usually simple and alternate, with a rough texture, while the flowers are small and inconspicuous. Cyathula kilimandscharica plays a role in local ecosystems and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
